doc.field: Organisation und Gremien der Universität Regensburg - Universität Regensburg

Organisation und Gremien der Universität Regensburg - Universität Regensburg Organisation und Gremien der Universität Regensburg - Universität Regensburg Startseite UR Organisation der UR Universitätsleitung Präsident Vizepräsidenten Senat Erweiterte Universitätsleitung Dekane und Dekaninnen Hochschulrat Kuratorium Studierenden-vertretungen Organisation und Gremien der Universität Regensburg Die Führung der Universität Regensburg obliegt der Universitätsleitung, die die laufenden Geschäfte der Universität führt. Ihr zur Seite stehen die Kollegialbereiche des Zentralbereichs: Der Senat, die erweiterte Universitätsleitung, der Hochschulrat und das Kuratorium. Der erweiterten Universitätsleitung gehören die Dekane unserer elf Fakultäten an. Die Studierenden der Universität Regenburg werden vertreten durch den Studentischen Konvent und den Sprecherrat. Innerhalb der Fakultäten bzw. Fachbereiche stehen den Studierenden die Fachschaften zur Seite. Im Rahmen der Hochschulwahlen werden jedes Jahr im Juni die studentischen Vertreter im Senat, in den Fakultätsräten und im Konvent bestimmt, jedes zweite Jahr finden außerdem Fakultätsrats- und Senatswahlen für alle Mitglieder der Universität statt. Referat Kommunikation - 11.02.2014 16:03 Universität Gremien

Leitbild der Universität Regensburg - Universität Regensburg

Leitbild der Universität Regensburg - Universität Regensburg Zu Hauptinhalt springen Navigation Forschung Studium Netzwerke International Chancengleichheit Studieninteressierte Bibliothek Rechenzentrum Verwaltung E-Learning Vorlesungen Webmail Aktuelles BAYHOST Einrichtungen Europaeum Fakultäten Flexnow Klinikum Kultur & Freizeit Mensa Personalrat Qualitätsmanagement RUL Sport Studentische Initiativen Technische Zentrale Uni-Shop ZHW ZSK Kontakt Impressum Datenschutz Startseite UR Leitbild Leitbild der Universität Regensburg Das Leitbild unserer Universität steht in der Version vom 15. Oktober 2007 im PDF-Format zum Download zur Verfügung. Es macht Sie mit unserem Selbstverständnis und unseren Leitzielen vertraut, darunter selbstverständlich Forschung und Lehre, aber auch Leistung, Interdisziplinarität, die regionale Verankerung und internationale Ausrichtung der Universität, der Forschungstransfer, ein partizipativer Führungsstil, Chancengleichheit und Dialog mit der Öffentlichkeit. Leitbild der Universität Regensburg (PDF/56 KB) Über den Entstehungsprozess des Leitbilds Der Entstehungsprozess des Leitbilds unterstreicht die Bedeutung der Partizipation aller Mitglieder der Universität: Das Leitbild wurde 2007 mit der Einführung eines Qualitätsmanagements für die Universität in einem internen uni-weiten Diskussionsprozess erarbeitet. Großen Wert legte die Universität dabei auf Transparenz und Beteiligung der verschiedenen Mitgliedergruppen sowie die termin- und ortsunabhängige Diskussionsmöglichkeit. Erreicht wurde dieses Ziel durch ein Online-Forum, in dem alle Angehörigen der Universität Beiträge zum Leitbild veröffentlichen oder bereits vorliegende Beiträge kommentieren konnten. Insgesamt registrierten sich 2.266 Teilnehmer in diesem Forum, was ca. 9 % aller Universitätsmitglieder waren und was die angestrebte breite Beteiligung am Leitbild-Prozess belegt. 61 % aller Teilnehmer und 49 % aller Beiträge kamen aus der Gruppe der Studierenden, der Rest verteilte sich anteilsmäßig auf Angestellte der Verwaltung, auf Lehrstühle und Institute. Insgesamt wurden 210 Beiträge verfasst, was gut 90 Din-A4-Seiten in der gedruckten Textdokumentation entspricht. Es wurde zwar nur ein Teil der Beiträge unmittelbar in den endgültigen Leitbildtext übernommen, es flossen aber zahlreiche inhaltliche Anregungen ein. Der offene Gedankenaustausch und die Zusammenarbeit aller Statusgruppen der Universität machen das Leitbild der Universität Regensburg zu einem erfolgreichen Gemeinschaftsprojekt und zu einer Besonderheit unter den Leitbildern in der deutschen Hochschullandschaft. Margit Adler - 22.11.2011 11:53 Universität Leitbild der Universität Regensburg

Kinderbetreuung - Universität Regensburg Zu Hauptinhalt springen Navigation Forschung Studium Netzwerke International Chancengleichheit Studieninteressierte Bibliothek Rechenzentrum Verwaltung E-Learning Vorlesungen Webmail Aktuelles BAYHOST Einrichtungen Europaeum Fakultäten Flexnow Klinikum Kultur & Freizeit Mensa Personalrat Qualitätsmanagement RUL Sport Studentische Initiativen Technische Zentrale Uni-Shop ZHW ZSK Kontakt Impressum Datenschutz Startseite UR Über uns Mitteilungen aus dem PR Zuständigkeiten Rechts-/Tarif-informationen Service Rabatte & Job-Ticket Stellen Kinderbetreuung JAV Kinderbetreuung Krabbelstube Uni Krabbelstuben Stadt Regensburg Kindergarten Uni Uni Kindergarten Der Verein J-UNI-KÄFER e.V. (Vorsitzende Frau Prof. Dr. Modrow) wurde 1996 gegründet und unterstützt ganz allgemein die Betreuung von Kindern im Bereich der Universität Regensburg und im speziellen die Kinder, die im Kindergarten der Universität an der Galgenbersgstraße untergebracht sind. Der Universitätskindergarten unterscheidet sich von übrigen Kindergärten dadurch, dass er spezielle an die Verhältnisse der Universitätsbediensteten ausgerichtete Öffnungszeiten anbietet. Augenblicklich (Stand: Dezember 2003) haben wir etwa 100 Mitglieder, überwiegend aus dem Bereich der Universität und des Klinikums. Der jährliche Mitgliederbeitrag beträgt 20 Euro und ist bewusst sehr nieder. Der Verein hat in der Vergangenheit (und wird auch in Zukunft) verschiedene Einrichtungen und Geräte im Bereich des Kindergartens finanzieren. So beispielsweise die Photovoltaik ? Anlage, die der Stromerzeugung im Kindergarten dient, Möbelstücke, Sport- und Musikgeräte und vieles mehr. Auch ?Events? wie Tierparkbesuche und Ausflüge werden gesponsert. Momentan unterstützen wir alle Eltern mit niedrigem Einkommen mit einem monatlichen Zuschuss zu den Kindergartenbeiträgen von 50,00 Euro, um so die doch sehr hohen Gebühren abzufedern (momentan ca. 450,00 Euro.) Weiterhin übernehmen wir die monatlichen Kosten für den Deutschunterricht (derzeit 175,00 Euro monatlich.) Der ist vor allem für die Kinder von nicht deutsch sprechenden Eltern als Vorbereitung auf die Einschulung essentiell. Mit nun über 600,00 Euro monatlichen Fixausgaben kommen wir aber deutlich an die Grenze, die wir uns leisten können, ohne die Reserven anzugreifen. Einen Teil des Geldes sparen wir auch an, um für weitere Investitionen unabhängig vom Betriebsträger des Kindergartens Mittel zur Verfügung haben. Unter der untenstehenden. Rubrik ?Aktuelles? können Sie sich über geplante oder anstehenden Aktivitäten des Vereins ?J-UNI-KÄFER? informieren. Um den Universitätskindergarten zu unterstützen werden Sie Mitglied im Verein ?J-UNI-Käfer? Hier finden Sie ein Beitrittsformular. Folgende Beiträge und Dokumente liegen vor: kinderbuch Der ?Kinderleicht Wissen Verlag? bietet neue Kinder ? Sachbuchreihen zu günstigen Preisen an. Näheres entnehmen sie bitten folgenden Link: BennyBlu (Stand: 02. Die SIM, die Studierenden der Informationswissenschaft und Medieninformatik sind ein (loser) Verbund von Studierenden, die sich um die Gestaltung des studentischen Lebens im Kielwasser dieser beiden Lehrstühle kümmern wollen. Wir sind keine Fachschaften und vertreten die Studierenden der beiden Fächer nicht hochschulpolitisch. Diese Aufgabe übernimmt für unsere Fakultät die Fachschaft Sprache, Literatur und Kultur. Wir versuchen Hilfestellungen beim Organisieren und Bewältigen des (informationswissenschaftlichen und medieninformatischen) Studiums zu bieten und sorgen mit einigen Veranstaltunge, Feiern und Exkursionen für ein abwechslungsreiches Semester. Jederzeit, gerne und mit offenen Armen werden Studierende Willkommen geheißen, die sich in diese Arbeit einbringen wollen! Unter News findet ihr aktuelle Meldungen, die in direktem Kontext zu Studium und Universität stehen und die wir euch sehr ans Herz legen. Unsere Seiten im Social Web erreicht ihr über die Buttons über dem Logo (Für alle Imperia-Jünger: Rechte Spalte). AG Globale Gerechtigkeit (AG3) - Universität Regensburg AG Globale Gerechtigkeit (AG3) - Universität Regensburg Startseite UR Neuigkeiten Wohnungsbörse Mitglieder Studierendenvertretung Arbeitskreise AG3 AK Gewerkschaften AK UniFair Lautschrift AK Vorrat Amnesty International AG Barrierefreiheit AK Queer Raumvergabe Service Kontakt Presse AG Globale Gerechtigkeit (AG3) Die AG Globale Gerechtigkeit (AG3) trifft sich auch dieses Semester zu regelmäßigen Sitzungen. Besuche von interessierten Studierenden sind sehr willkommen ? schreib uns einfach eine Mail, und wir sagen dir, wann der nächste Termin ansteht. Die AG3 beschäftigt sich mit Fragen der Globalisierung und setzt sich für ein höheres Maß an Gerechtigkeit im Miteinander der Nationen ein. Dabei werden Themen wie Freihandel, Liberalisierung von Märkten, Folgen der Globalisierung für die Umwelt und die soziale Verfassung der Staaten, Sozial- und Steuerdumping im internationalen Wettbewerb uvm. kritisch hinterfragt. Wir wollen eine gerechtere und friedlichere Welt unter der Perspektive von nachhaltiger Entwicklung und Verwirklichung der Menschenrechte. Wir glauben, dass Globalisierung kein Schicksal ist, sondern durch lokales Handeln gerechter gestaltet werden kann. Eine andere Welt ist möglich! Informationen rund ums Thema und aktuelle Veranstaltungen der AG3 findest du auf unserer Facebook-Seite! http://www.facebook.com/AktionsgruppeGlobaleGerechtigkeit Studentischer SprecherInnenrat - 27.08.2012 22:08 Universität Kontakt zur AG3 Vor Ort: Büro des AStA im Studentenhaus, 1. Gemeinsam setzen wir uns hochschulgruppenu?bergreifend fu?r die Belange der Studie- renden ein und greifen dabei verschiedene gesellschaftspolitische Themen auf. Neben dem Organisieren der Studentischen Hilfskra?fte liegt unser Schwerpunkt auf der Vernetzung von Studierenden mit Gewerkschaften und den Angestellten der Uni. Neueinsteiger und Interessierte sind jederzeit willkommen. Ihr mu?sst u?brigens nicht Mitglied in einer Gewerkschaft sein, um bei uns mitzumachen. Wir treffen uns jeden ersten und dritten Dienstag im Monat um 18 Uhr im Raum PT 4.0.76e. Wenn ihr arbeitsrechtliche Fragen oder Unklarheiten habt, sind wir dankbar, wenn ihr uns davon berichtet. Nur so können wir Probleme erkennen. Außerdem gibt es eine Sprechstunde mit einem Experten. AK Queer - Universität Regensburg AK Queer - Universität Regensburg Startseite UR Neuigkeiten Wohnungsbörse Mitglieder Studierendenvertretung Arbeitskreise AG3 AK Gewerkschaften AK UniFair Lautschrift AK Vorrat Amnesty International AG Barrierefreiheit AK Queer Raumvergabe Service Kontakt Presse AK Queer Der AK Queer setzt sich hauptsächlich aus Mitgliedern des gemeinnützigen regensburger Vereins Jung und Gleich e.V. zusammen. Wir sind eine Gruppe von Studierenden diverser Fachrichtungen, die an der Uni Regensburg der Ansprechpartner für alle an queerer Kultur Interessierten sein will. Zudem bieten wir eine Anlaufstelle für junge Erwachsene, die sich ihrer sexuellen Orientierung nicht sicher sind oder vor Problemen des Coming-Outs stehen. Die verschiedenen Ziele und Arbeitsgebiete des AK Queer sind: Beratung für Jugendliche, junge Erwachsene und Eltern, die u.a. mit dem Coming Out Probleme haben Aufklärungsarbeit an Bildungseinrichtungen und Institutionen Sensibilisierung der Politik für die Thematik Möglichkeiten der Freizeitgestalltung um andre Schwule, Lesben und Trans* kennen zu lernen Etablierung, Organisation und Förderung Queerer-Kultur, Queerer-Gemeinschaft und Queerer-Veranstaltungen an der Uni Regensburg und in Regensburg Zusammenarbeit mit vergleichbaren Initativen und Vereinigungen in Regensburg und der Region Der AK Queer trifft sich regelmäßig am ersten Mittwoch im Monat im W1 (Weingasse 1, Regensburg). Gäste und Interessierte sind jederzeit herzlich eingeladen. Sondertreffen, z.B. zur Vorbereitung von Aktionen werden auf www.jungundgleich.org und www.facebook.com/jungundgleich veröffentlicht. Studentischer Sprecherrat - 05.04.2013 16:01 Universität

AK Unifair - Universität Regensburg AK Unifair - Universität Regensburg Startseite UR Neuigkeiten Wohnungsbörse Mitglieder Studierendenvertretung Arbeitskreise AG3 AK Gewerkschaften AK UniFair Lautschrift AK Vorrat Amnesty International AG Barrierefreiheit AK Queer Raumvergabe Service Kontakt Presse AK Unifair Der Arbeitskreis Unifair verkauft am Campus regelmäßig fair gehandelte Produkte wie Kaffee und Schokolade. Helfer sind immer gerne gesehen! Durch fair gehandelte Produkte wird den Erzeugern der Waren ein Preis für ihre Produkte garantiert, der ihnen ein menschenwürdiges Leben ermöglicht. Viele Bauern in den Ländern Südamerikas, Asiens und Afrikas können ihre Waren nur zu Dumpingpreisen an europäische oder nordamerikanische Konzerne verkaufen. Verarmung, Landflucht und Zerstörung schützenswerter ökologischer Ressourcen sind die Folge dieser Entwicklung. Wer fair gehandelte Produkte kauft, leistet einen echten Beitrag zur Armutsbekämpfung und zum Umweltschutz in der Dritten Welt. Nach langen Verhandlungen mit dem Studentenwerk konnte der AK Unifair zusammen mit der AG Globale Gerechtigkeit erreichen, dass es nun fairen Kaffee in allen Cafeten gibt. Studentischer Sprecherrat - 16.10.2012 09:18 Universität Wo finde ich den AK Unifair? Kontakt per E-Mail Homepage: ak-unifair.de.vu Aktuelle Verkaufszeiten: dienstags, mittwochs und donnerstags um die Mittagszeit vor der Unimensa oder beim PT-Gebäude

Amnesty International: Hochschulgruppe - Universität Regensburg Amnesty International: Hochschulgruppe - Universität Regensburg Startseite UR Neuigkeiten Wohnungsbörse Mitglieder Studierendenvertretung Arbeitskreise AG3 AK Gewerkschaften AK UniFair Lautschrift AK Vorrat Amnesty International AG Barrierefreiheit AK Queer Raumvergabe Service Kontakt Presse Amnesty International: Hochschulgruppe ?Alle Menschen sind frei und gleich an Würde und Rechten geboren.? ?Jeder hat das Recht auf Leben, Freiheit und Sicherheit der Person.? ?Niemand darf willkürlich festgenommen, in Haft gehalten oder des Landes verwiesen werden.? Diese und weitere Rechte, die der Allgemeinen Erklärung der Menschenrechte von 1948 entstammen, stehen jedem Menschen zu. Auch dir. Für dich mögen sie vielleicht selbstverständlich sein, doch jeden Tag erreichen uns Bilder in den Nachrichten, die zeigen, dass die Einhaltung von grundlegenden Menschenrechten keinesfalls überall eine Selbstverständlichkeit darstellt. Um diesen Menschenrechtsverletzungen entgegenzuwirken, wurde vor über 50 Jahren die Nichtregierungsorganisation Amnesty International ins Leben gerufen. Seit Mai 2012 gibt es nun auch in Regensburg ? speziell für Studenten ? eine Hochschulgruppe von Amnesty International. Wir sind ein bunt zusammengewürfelter Haufen von Studenten verschiedenster Fachrichtungen und einigen Schülern. Durch Öffentlichkeitsarbeit, das Sammeln von Unterschriften oder die Durchführung von öffentlichkeitswirksamen Aktionen versuchen wir auf Menschrechtsverletzungen aufmerksam zu machen und diese zu unterbinden. Dabei sind der Kreativität keine Grenzen gesetzt: Jeder kann bei uns seine eigenen Ideen und Vorstellungen einbringen. Zurzeit ist Nordkorea unser Schwerpunkt ? wir sind aber auch jederzeit für andere Themenbereiche offen. Wenn dich unsere Arbeit interessiert und du Lust hast, in unserer Gruppe mitzuarbeiten, kannst du gerne unverbindlich bei einem unserer Treffen vorbeikommen. Du findest uns in der Regel donnerstags ab 20 Uhr im AStA-Büro (Studentenhaus, Zi. 1.27). Die Lautschrift ist das Campusmagazin der Universität Regensburg. Ihre Redaktion setzt sich aus Studierenden aller Fachrichtungen zusammen. Die Lautschrift will Sprachrohr für die Regensburger Studentinnen und Studenten sein; in Themenheften wollen wir Hintergründe und Meinungen zum Geschehen auf dem Campus und darüber hinaus bieten. Unsere Hauptausgaben werden regelmäßig um Publikationen zu den Hochschulwahlen sowie um aktuelle Berichte und Kommentare auf unserer Webseite ergänzt. Besucht uns auch auf unserer Facebook-Seite! Du willst mitmachen? Wir suchen immer neue Redaktionsmitglieder, egal ob ihr gerne schreibt, fotografiert oder layoutet. Bedingung ist nur, dass ihr in Regensburg studiert und Spaß an redaktioneller Arbeit habt. Meldet euch einfach bei uns! Als stv. Vorsitzender vertrete ich den RCDS Regensburg e.V. und bin Mitglied des amtierenden studentischen Konvents. Als Sprecher des Sprecherrats der Universität Regensburg setzte ich mich bei universitären Entscheidungen für eine "starke studentische Stimme" ein. Die Anliegen und Interessen der Studenten dürfen keine Worthülsen bleiben; Sie müssen gegenüber der Hochschulleitung, dem Studentenwerk, sowie dem Wissenschaftsministerium ihre Repräsentation finden. Hierfür ist es meine Hauptaufgabe, die Arbeit im Sprecherrat zu koordinieren, um aus den beiden Sprechern und den einzelnen Referatsleitern ein produktives Gremium für die Interessen der Regensburger Studenten zu schaffen. superuser superuser - 06.03.2014 11:20 Universität So erreicht ihr uns Unser Büro im Studentenhaus, Zi. 1.27, ist vormittags immer besetzt. Im studentischen Sprecherinnen und Sprecherrat bin ich für die Anliegen der SHKs und NWHKs zuständig. Diese leisten ein wichtigen Beitrag zum Funktionieren der Universität Regensburg. In Verwaltung, Forschung und Lehre übernehmen sie wichtige Aufgaben. Sie sind aus dem Universitätsleben nicht wegzudenken. Ich bin selber SHK und habe mir vorgenommen eine Vertretung für sie zu schaffen. In Zukunft soll nichts über die Köpfe der SHKs hinweg entschieden werden, sie sollen eine Stimme erhalten. Die SHKs sollen keine Sonderrechte bekommen, nur Mitspracherechte, wie es sie für andere relevanten Gruppen an der Universität längst gibt. Ich bitte um Euer Vertrauen und stehe jederzeit für Eure Fragen und Probleme zur Verfügung. Stephan Klingl - Universität Regensburg Stephan Klingl - Universität Regensburg Startseite UR Neuigkeiten Wohnungsbörse Mitglieder Sven Hübschen Alexander Eiber Ray Dinauer Cornelius Merz Tobias Hartl Stephan Klingl Simon Budde Heinrich Kielhorn Magdalena Janko Studierendenvertretung Arbeitskreise Raumvergabe Service Kontakt Presse Stephan Klingl Referent für Kultur und Internationales Kontaktdaten: Mobil: 0160-8102911 Email: stephklingl@aol.com Die Universität soll mehr als eine Bildungsfabrik sein. Vielmehr soll sie einen Lebensraum, geprägt durch Demokratie und studentischem Engagement, darstellen. Eine der wichtigsten Triebfedern der studentischen Partizipation ist hierbei sicherlich das kulturelle Leben, mit all seinen unterschiedlichen Ausprägungen: von Partys über Konzerte bis hin zu Theatervorführungen. So hat die kulturelle Arbeit das Ziel, dass StudentInnen die Uni nicht nur als Aneinanderreihung von schnöden Hörsälen und Bibliotheken sehen, sondern als einen Ort, der sich durch seine kulturelle Heterogenität auszeichnet. Meine Hauptaufgabe als Referent für Kultur und Internationales ist hierbei, die schon zahlreich vorhandenen Projekte und Gruppierungen besser zu vernetzten und somit deren Arbeit zu vereinfachen. Sven Hübschen - Universität Regensburg Sven Hübschen - Universität Regensburg Startseite UR Neuigkeiten Wohnungsbörse Mitglieder Sven Hübschen Alexander Eiber Ray Dinauer Cornelius Merz Tobias Hartl Stephan Klingl Simon Budde Heinrich Kielhorn Magdalena Janko Studierendenvertretung Arbeitskreise Raumvergabe Service Kontakt Presse Sven Hübschen Studentischer Sprecher KontaktDaten: Mobil: 0151-61221060 Email: sven.huebschen@gmail.com Bis in den Sommer 2014 fällt mir die interessante und reizvolle Aufgabe zu, euch, die Studierenden der Universität Regensburg als studentischer Sprecher, zu vertreten. Was bedeutet dies eigentlich für mich? Logischerweise sehe ich es als meine Aufgabe, die Interessen der Studierenden nach innen und außen wahrzunehmen, also bei Sitzungen der universitären Gremien, aber auch Außerhalb der Universität, die Studierenden umfänglich zu Vertreten sowie Pressemitteilungen herauszugeben. Dabei darf allerdings nicht ausgeblendet werden, dass es in aller erster Linie um den Menschen geht. Also stehen der Lebensraum Universität und damit ihr alle, die ihr hier an diesem Lebensraum teilhabt, für mich im Mittelpunkt meiner Arbeit. Neben meiner politischen Arbeit dürft ihr daher bei mir immer mit einem offenen Ohr für eurer kreatives Mitwirken an der weiteren Optimierung unseres gemeinsamen Lebensraums Universität rechnen. A Campus University - Universität Regensburg A Campus University - Universität Regensburg UR Home Welcome Research & Teaching Degree Programmes Dialogue of Cultures A Campus University Student Life A Campus University The Universität Regensburg is located on a campus of 150 hectares at the southern edge of the Old Town that is only 20 minutes away by bus. All the university?s buildings and facilities are within walking distance of each other, and an abundance of trees and lawns between each building creates a relaxed environment for your study and research. Cafeterias are located throughout campus, and a main refectory, where lunch is served, is situated in the centre of campus. The library is made up of the main complex and 11 branch libraries spread throughout the campus. In total, the libraries house more than 3.4 million books, periodicals and other research materials, all organized under an easy-to-use computerised search programme. Students have access to about 700 computers in any one of the 28 computer labs on campus provided by the university's computer centre. ...read more about student life at the Universität Regensburg... Degree Programmes - Universität Regensburg Degree Programmes - Universität Regensburg UR Home Welcome Research & Teaching Degree Programmes Dialogue of Cultures A Campus University Student Life Degree Programmes With its 11 faculties, the Universität Regensburg offers a wide range of programmes of study. Almost all faculties (few exceptions are e.g. Medicine and Pharmacy) have modularised their Bachelor and Master programmes. The B.A. programmes at the university comprise two or three subjects that are studied simultaneously. In the B.Sc. course of study, one subject is studied as the main focus. Bachelor programmes are based on a three-year study cycle, Master programmes on a two-years cycle. ...read more about the dialogue of cultures... Dialogue of Cultures - Universität Regensburg Dialogue of Cultures - Universität Regensburg UR Home Welcome Research & Teaching Degree Programmes Dialogue of Cultures A Campus University Student Life Dialogue of Cultures Due to its geographical location, the Universität Regensburg has always considered itself a bridge between East and West and accordingly aims to strengthen the dialogue of cultures. With the Europaeum, it has set up an interdisciplinary centre for research and teaching on all aspects pertaining to Central, Eastern and South-Eastern Europe. The Bavarian Academic Center for Central, Eastern, and South-Eastern Europe (BAYHOST), which is a service centre for all Bavarian institutions of higher education, is also housed at the Universität Regensburg. Our university welcomes both students and visiting scholars any time. The International Office is the point of contact for all questions concerning your stay at Universität Regensburg. Moreover, Regensburg hosts an International School offering English-speaking education for school children from international families. ...read more about our campus university... Student Life - Universität Regensburg Student Life - Universität Regensburg UR Home Welcome Research & Teaching Degree Programmes Dialogue of Cultures A Campus University Student Life Student Life Students with Special Needs The Universität Regensburg gives high priority to students with special needs. Most parts of the campus are accessible by wheelchair. In addition, the computer centre as well as the library provide special facilities for visually impaired students. Extra-curricular Activities A vibrant cultural life has developed on the campus, with more than 20 student theatre groups and various choirs and orchestras. The university auditorium attracts a large audience from the city itself and beyond with its many internationally renowned music and theater performances. Each semester, the sports centre offers a vast selection of recreational courses for all students ranging from aikido and canoeing to rock-climbing and yoga. City and Student Life Last but not least, the attractiveness of the university is enhanced by the appeal of the city itself, with its everpresent traces of more than 2,000 years of history. Since July 2006, Regensburg has carried the UNESCO distinction ?World Heritage?, which recognizes the unique character of the medieval city centre and its magnificent architecture?above all the Old Stone Bridge over the Danube and St. Peter?s Cathedral. Regensburg?s townscape still testifies to the economic and cultural vitality and the political eminence of the city during the Middle Ages Referat Kommunikation - 24.06.2014 13:54 University Student Life

Schedule of Dates - Universität Regensburg Schedule of Dates - Universität Regensburg UR Home Exchange Students News Application Planning Your Stay Forms Schedule of Dates Accommodation Formalities Erasmus Formalities Learning German Courses and Course Selection Arrival Information Life in Regensburg FAQ Download Contact Schedule of Dates We have prepared for you an overview of all important dates during the academic year concerning your arrival in Regensburg, language and orientation programme, registration for courses, etc. Please note that this overview is approximate only. All precise dates will be sent to you in separate e-mails and letters. During your stay in Regensburg, please make sure that you check not only your normal e-mail address but also your UR e-mail address!! Read all information carefully. What do I have to do before arriving in Regensburg? Shortly before your arrival in Regensburg: Students from European countries: Contact your insurance company about the EHIC or an equivalent document (see also Health Insurance)! Please inform the International Office when you will be arriving. Please send this information no later than 2 weeks before your arrival! Bring all of the information needed from your bank account at home in order to receive transfers (name of the account holder, account number, name of the bank, IBAN and Swiftcode). After you have left Regensburg and returned to your home country, your deposit will be transferred back to this account. Talk to the programme coordinator at your home university about the number of courses and exams as well as about the type of courses (lectures, seminars, etc.) you should sign up for here in Regensburg. Please ask where your ?Transcript of Records? should be sent to after your stay in Regensburg. The International Office needs a mailing address, the name of the contact person, and the title of the department/faculty. Transportation Information - Universität Regensburg Transportation Information - Universität Regensburg UR Home Exchange Students News Application Accommodation Formalities Erasmus Formalities Learning German Courses and Course Selection Arrival Information Don't forget Visa / Residence Permit Transportation Information Life in Regensburg FAQ Download Contact Transportation Information You can come to Regensburg by plane (Munich Airport), train, and by car. Once you have arrived in Regensburg, please come to the International Office and fetch your keys for the room of your student residence. Photo: James Cridland (CC BY 2.0) Maps: location map, campus map and floor plan administration building Arrival by Plane There is no airport in Regensburg. The closest one is Munich Airport but you can also fly to Nuremberg or Frankfurt. Trains leave regularly from all these airports to Regensburg. At www.bahn.de you will find schedules, connections and prices. Arrival at Munich Airport: If you arrive at Munich Airport, there are two ways to get to Regensburg: Shuttle service: There is a commercial shuttle service running from Munich Airport to Regensburg. You can find more information at: http://www.airportliner.com. Costs: EUR 42. Advance booking necessary! Have the shuttle drop you at the bus stop "Universität Mensa" and follow the signs to the International Office! Bus and train to Regensburg: If you take the train from the Munich airport to Regensburg, you do not need to go to the central train station in Munich. Take bus 635 from in front of the airport's central area (Z) to the train station in Freising (the trip takes approximately 20 minutes) and change here to a train to Regensburg. All trains running between Munich and Regensburg stop at Freising. This will save you time and money. Costs for train and bus are EUR 21. A taxi from the Regensburg train station to the university costs about EUR 10. For a more detailed description of how to get from Munich Airport (Terminal 1) to Regensburg look HERE. Arrival by Car If you are coming via Autobahn A3 (from Nuremberg or Passau), take the exit "Universität/Klinikum", follow the signs to "Universität". You will turn left into a small street with a tunnel. Inside the tunnel turn left at the second turn ("Tiefgarage West" towards the end of the tunnel) and park in the garage. Different garage sections are marked in different colours. Park your car in the yellow area. Exit the garage through the door in the yellow area that says "Verwaltung". (It's at the left hand side towards the end of the garage. Take the elevator up to the 1st floor (ground floor, the button in the elevator reads "F0"). You'll find us there around the corner, room 0.18a (map: administration building). If you come via Autobahn A 93, please continue towards the intersection "Autobahnkreuz Regensburg" and change to A3, direction Passau/Linz/Regensburg Ost. Then follow the instructions above. How to get to campus Arrival by Train At www.bahn.de you will find schedules, connections and prices. Once you have arrived in Regensburg, please leave your heavy luggage at the station!!! The lockers are at "Gleis 1". Exit the station building towards the city centre. As you exit, you'll see a small park and a yellow church across the street, to your right. Cross the street, enter the park and pass the little yellow church. The bus stop for buses to the University is at the corner to your right, immediately at the beginning of the bridge ("Galgenberger Brücke"). Either take a) bus number 6, direction "Universität/Klinikum". Get off at the stop "Universitaet Mensa" b) bus nr 11, direction "Universitaet/ Burgweinting". Get off at the stop "Universitaet Mensa". Once at the University - IO How do I get to the International Office? Once you are on campus, go to the International Office where you will receive your keys. The International Office is on the ground floor of the administration building (Verwaltungsgebäude), rooms no. 18a or 16, in the centre of the campus (campus map + floor plan administration building). Office Hours: During the arrival days, the International Office is usually open for incoming students from 9 am to 5.30 pm. (Please refer to room offer, which is part of your information package!) During the semester it is open from 9:30 am to 11:30 am only. What if I arrive in Regensburg on the weekend or after 5:30 pm? If you arrive later than 5.30 pm or on the weekend, you will have to stay in a hotel or in the youth hostel . The International Office will send you a list of hotels in Regensburg . If you arrive very early (e.g. with the bus from Poland), you can wait on campus until our office opens. The most convenient place to wait is in the upper foyer of the Audimax building (across from the administration building, see map). Christine Betzner - 05.06.2014 11:28 UR International Exchange Students - Coordinator Susanne Gschnaidner CONTACT Academic Calendar Course Catalogue Courses in English ? Información en español

Course Selection - Universität Regensburg Course Selection - Universität Regensburg UR Home Exchange Students News Application Accommodation Formalities Erasmus Formalities Learning German Courses and Course Selection Course Selection ECTS Courses in English Transcript of Records Arrival Information Life in Regensburg FAQ Download Contact Course Selection Course Selection / Learning Agreement For your stay in Regensburg you need to know which courses will be offered during your time in Regensburg and what your schedule looks like. On top of that, as an ERASMUS-student you will need to hand in a so-called ?Learning Agreement? with your nomination. On the basis of this learning agreement you plan your studies in Regensburg and make sure that the Regensburg courses will be recognised back home. Our course catalogue is usually released too late for you to use it before your arrival in Regensburg. Therefore, we recommend that you work with the course catalogues of prior semesters and update your schedule after your arrival in Regensburg. Many faculties offer the same courses each winter or each summer semester. This is the case for the business faculty, the natural sciences or the law faculty. In all other cases we recommend that you select the types of courses you are interested in (e.g. ?Proseminar in Neuere Deutsche Literaturwissenschaft? and finalize your course planning once you are in Regensburg. You will find an online version of old and new course catalogues HERE. To learn more about ECTS credits please see the following link: www.uni-regensburg.de/ur-international/exchange-students/courses/ects/overview/index.html What can you do before your arrival? Talk to your institutional coordinator about the number and types of courses you will take in Regensburg and about the number of exams you ought to take. For subjects that are frequently taken by our exchange students you may find further information on the selection of courses and credit allocation on our homepage: www.uni-regensburg.de/ur-international/exchange-students/courses/ects/faculties/index.html =>Courses (ECTS) Another good source of information are the individual web pages of the departments as these lists are usually up to date: http://www.uni-regensburg.de/fakultaeten Please arrive early enough for the orientation programme in Regensburg. As the registration procedure is not centralised, it is very important to be here in time. Please make sure that you stick to the arrival dates. You will receive all necessary information on course selection, registration, transcript of records, and more during this programme. Which courses can you take? Basically, you are free to take any courses throughout all faculties (with the exception of Medicine, Dentistry, Biochemistry, Pharmacy and English and American Studies). Students of Medicine, Dentistry, Biochemistry, and Pharmacy are asked to contact the departmental coordinator of their exchange programme to get approval of their course choice especially if they want to take practical courses like laboratory courses. A regular programme of study carries 30 ECTS credits for each semester. During the semester you may also take German or other foreign language classes. Academic Study Concerns At German universities, a certain amount of self responsibility is expected from students. For example, there are no pre-determined class schedules: rather it is the task of the student to put together his or her own programme of courses. Different facilities however can help you out with finding your way around the University. Courses Offered The course catalogue (Vorlesungsverzeichnis ) provides information about the courses offered during each semester. The details provided in it can be compared with the current course information posted on the notice boards of the faculties and institutes. Semester Schedule From these details, students individually can put together their semester schedule. Assistance and advice for this task is given by departmental coordinators, who are instructors from individual subjects with the special assignment of helping exchange students with the selection of their courses. All exchange students should introduce themselves to the departmental coordinator in their course of study. Additional help is given in the introductory sessions organized by the individual institutions. You will find out the dates for these introductory sessions from the International Office before the semester begins. Proof of Academic Achievement Currently only in a few subjects there is a central computer system that records the courses taken by students and their grades. In most subjects, students receive a certificate about the course they have taken. In the University system, this certificate is called a Schein. Exchange students must pick up the Schein from the instructor themselves or have the Schein sent to the International Office. Copies of each Schein must be handed in at the International Office to receive your Transcript of Records. Christine Betzner - 05.06.2014 11:22 UR International Exchange Students - Coordinator Susanne Gschnaidner CONTACT Academic Calendar Course Catalogue Courses in English ? Información en español

Transcript of Records - Universität Regensburg Transcript of Records - Universität Regensburg UR Home Exchange Students News Application Accommodation Formalities Erasmus Formalities Learning German Courses and Course Selection Course Selection ECTS Courses in English Transcript of Records Arrival Information Life in Regensburg FAQ Download Contact Transcript of Records What is a transcript of records? All courses that you take and for which you perform work during your stay at the University of Regensburg are listed on the transcript of records. The number of ECTS points is also recorded on the transcript of records along with the title, number of hours, and grade. From this, your home university can figure out the amount of work you did for the respective course and the number of credits with which your academic performance is recognized. How do I receive a transcript of records? Shortly after the beginning of the semester you will fill out a so-called Belegbogen, which is a course record sheet. In this form you will write in all the courses that you are taking during the semester (sample course record sheet ). The deadline for completing the course record sheet will be given to you during the orientation course before the beginning of the semester. At the end of the semester you will receive a so-called Schein with a grade and number of credits for the courses in which you performed work. Please give a copy of the original Schein to the International Office before departing Regensburg. In case the Schein has not yet been made out at the time of your departure, please emphasize to your instructors that they should send the Schein to the International Office. The International Office will then send you the transcript and the original Schein as soon as the transcript of records is complete. For questions concerning the transcript of records, please contact our student assistant, Ms Nicole Killisperger. All forms are available on our download section. Please pay attention: by all means let the IO know before your departure if you in fact did not complete some of the courses that were in your course record sheet! Otherwise the course record sheet will be held up by that Schein?and you will have to wait a long time for your transcript! Christine Betzner - 05.06.2014 11:24 UR International Exchange Students - Coordinator Susanne Gschnaidner CONTACT Academic Calendar Course Catalogue Courses in English ? Información en español

Please give a copy of the original Schein to the International Office before departing Regensburg. In case the Schein has not yet been made out at the time of your departure, please emphasize to your instructors that they should send the Schein to the International Office. The International Office will then send you the transcript and the original Schein as soon as the transcript of records is complete. For questions concerning the transcript of records, please contact our student assistant, Ms Nicole Killisperger. All forms are available on our download section. Please pay attention: by all means let the IO know before your departure if you in fact did not complete some of the courses that were in your course record sheet! Otherwise the course record sheet will be held up by that Schein?and you will have to wait a long time for your transcript! Christine Betzner - 05.06.2014 11:24 UR International Exchange Students - Coordinator Susanne Gschnaidner CONTACT Academic Calendar Course Catalogue Courses in English ? Información en español
Bank Account and Money - Universität Regensburg

Bank Account and Money - Universität Regensburg Bank Account and Money - Universität Regensburg UR Home Exchange Students News Application Accommodation Formalities Visa / Residence Permit Health Insurance Enrolment Bank Account and Money Erasmus Formalities Learning German Courses and Course Selection Arrival Information Life in Regensburg FAQ Download Contact Bank Account and Money How much money should I bring? Most students need approximately ?650 per month to live in Regensburg, which includes the room's rent. Per semester you need to estimate roughly ?100 for books and at least ?50 for other study materials. You need to add ?127 for the Studentenwerk membership (including the semester ticket for the bus), which all students have to purchase. Consider bringing enough cash or traveller's cheques with you to Germany to pay for all expenses you incur in the first month! It often takes up to two weeks for money transfers to be deposited in a German bank account. Bear in mind that you have to pay for your first month's of rent shortly after arrival. Must I open a bank account? After arrival in Regensburg, you must open a bank account ("Girokonto"; no savings account or "Sparkonto"). The Studentenwerk requires a German bank account for you to pay your rent. Rent cannot - under no circumstances - be paid by credit card! Bank are open most days between 9.00 am and 4.00 pm and Thursdays until 5.30 pm. Some branches are closed between 1.00pm and 2.30 pm. Credit card, debit card or cash? Cash is the preferred way to either pay for bills or purchases in Germany. Credit cards are not accepted at all retailers. For this reason, bring enough cash with you for the first few weeks. With your debit card and a pin number you can take out money from teller machines, and pay for purchases at several shops. Eurocheques are not accepted anymore and traveller's cheques only can be cashed at banks. Rent and insurance (does not apply for EHIC) must be paid through bank transfer. Enrolment - Universität Regensburg Enrolment - Universität Regensburg UR Home Exchange Students News Application Accommodation Formalities Visa / Residence Permit Health Insurance Enrolment Bank Account and Money Erasmus Formalities Learning German Courses and Course Selection Arrival Information Life in Regensburg FAQ Download Contact Enrolment What do I need to consider to enrol? The University of Regensburg is not allowed to proceed with your enrolment without proof of health insurance. Thus, you must present a health insurance certificate when you enrol. Please, go to one of the compulsory health insurance providers in Regensburg before enrolment (the IO will supply you with addresses upon arrival). There you will either receive proof that you have taken out German compulsory health insurance or that your are exempt from this obligation (due to the European Health Insurance Card EHIC or other appropriate insurance proof). This document must be presented to the Office of the Registrar when you enrol. After you enrol, you can apply for your residence permit. Visa / Residence Permit - Universität Regensburg Visa / Residence Permit - Universität Regensburg UR Home Exchange Students News Application Accommodation Formalities Visa / Residence Permit Health Insurance Enrolment Bank Account and Money Erasmus Formalities Learning German Courses and Course Selection Arrival Information Life in Regensburg FAQ Download Contact Visa / Residence Permit Visa and Residence Permit (if necessary) European citizens as well as those from Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, Switzerland, Israel, Canada, Japan, South Korea, Australia, New Zealand, USA, and Brazil do not need a visa! Exchange students who come from other countries need to apply for a "student visa" at a German consulate or embassy in their home country. Your student visa must be converted into a residence permit within the first three months of your arrival. Please contact the Immigration Office in Regensburg for this matter. Do not come in the country as a tourist! Once you have entered the country, your tourist visa cannot be converted into a student visa. A complete list of countries with visa requirements is available on the homepage of the German Ministry of Foreign Affairs. Please make sure that your passport is valid for your whole stay in Germany. Christine Betzner - 29.11.2012 09:40 UR International Exchange Students - Coordinator Susanne Gschnaidner CONTACT Academic Calendar Course Catalogue Courses in English ? Información en español

International Office - Universität Regensburg International Office - Universität Regensburg UR Home International Office Contacts Incomings Welcome Center Outgoing Students Exchange Programmes in Europe Head of IO / Exchange Programmes Overseas International Office International Office Contacts Welcome to the International Office of the UR! Here you will find important information and advice for prospective exchange students, prospective international students, and guest scholars and researchers on the University of Regensburg. Studying at UR The International Office (IO) is the first resource for all international and exchange students in regards to your studies at UR. Exchange Students We provide you with information about the application process, pre-arrival and everything related to your adjustment phase in Regensburg. Contact International Degree-Seeking Students / Visiting Students Here you can access a great amount of information concerning the application process to enter a study programme at UR. During your studies, the International Office will answer your questions on studying and living in Regensburg (for example, health insurance, residence law, or the social environment in Regensburg). Contact Doing Research and Doctoral Studies Welcome Center for International Researchers and PhD Candidates We offer international scholars and PhD candidates help to find suitable accommodation and to fulfill the various formalities. If you are considering to come with family, you can also benefit from information and support regarding assistance for partners or finding appropriate child care or schooling options. Contact Going Abroad Studying and Doing an Internship Abroad During your studies at UR, would you like the chance to gain long-term international experience? We offer information on our world-wide exchange programmes and assist you in the exchange student application and planning process for your stay at our partner universities. If you would like to independently apply to an abroad university or for a scholarship, we would also be happy to provide assistance. We can also assist you in procuring scholarship funds to finance an internship abroad. Come to our office hours for further information! Contact Exchange Programm Coordination / Director of IO Should you have questions about a cooperation agreement or you would like to become a UR partner university, please get in touch with Marianne Sedlmeier, IO Director. IO Director Marianne Sedlmeier Coordinators of Exchange Programmes Marianne Sedlmeier (Overseas) Maria Grotz (Europe/ERASMUS) Mailing address: Universität Regensburg Akademisches Auslandsamt / International Office Universitätsstr. 31 93053 Regensburg GERMANY Christine Betzner - 28.11.2013 09:31 UR International UR INTERNATIONAL International Office Contact point for: ?Studying at the UR ?Studying abroad ?Internationalization of the UR

How do you find a room? - Universität Regensburg

How do you find a room? - Universität Regensburg How do you find a room? - Universität Regensburg UR Home International Degree Seeking Students News Degree Programmes German Skills Application / Admission / Registration Visa and Residence Regulations Finances Health Services Arrival Information Accommodation How do you find a room? Short Term Accommodation Student Residences Startklar ? Orientation Programme Organizing Your Studies Life in Regensburg FAQ Download Contact How do you find a room? Student Residences of the "Studentenwerk" In Regensburg you will find private student residences as well as student residences of the Studentenwerk (German Student Service Association). The Student Service Association reserves a certain number of rooms for international students. All new students receive the application form for a room in a students residence together with their letter of admission. We are sorry to say though that we have many more applicants than available rooms. For this reason, it is absolutley necessary that you show initiative and look for a room on your own on the private market. Private Student Residences Besides the German Students Service Association there are a lot of other organisations that run student residences. The following link provides you with a list of these private students residences. Online-Search for Rooms http://www.stwno.de/joomla/de/wohnen/zimmerboerse Weitere Möglichkeiten der Zimmersuche: Private ADS Private ads for rooms can be found all over campus on black boards in the cafeterias, in the student service centre, etc. Newspaper using the local newspaper: http://www.mittelbayerische.de/immobilien/ Internet Using the internet / useful internet pages: http.//www.wg-gesucht.de http.//www.studenten-wg.de http://www.wohngemeinschaft.de/ Christine Betzner - 23.05.2014 09:36 UR International Accommodation Sigrid Baumann Information and advice on accommodation for international students Contact

Student Residences - Universität Regensburg Student Residences - Universität Regensburg UR Home International Degree Seeking Students News Degree Programmes German Skills Application / Admission / Registration Visa and Residence Regulations Finances Health Services Arrival Information Accommodation How do you find a room? Short Term Accommodation Student Residences Startklar ? Orientation Programme Organizing Your Studies Life in Regensburg FAQ Download Contact Student Residences You will find a number of student residences in Regensburg. Several residences are run by the "Studentenwerk" (official accommodation service), who provides the International Office with a number of rooms for international students. International students send their housing application for residences of the Studentenwerk to the International Office. Students with German nationality need to apply directly to the Studentenwerk. For most private student residences you will have to apply directly to the individual residence.Please see list of residences below. Foto: Studentenwerk Regensburg Student Residences of the Studentenwerk The Studentenwerk is a public organization that is responsible for all kinds of advisory services. It also runs the Mensa (main cafeteria) and several student residences. The rooms in the student residences are only for the registered students. When you apply for a room you have to indicate your programme of studies. Foreign students, specially from far away countries, are given priority. If you want a room you have to apply early enough at the IO (International Office). As there are more applications as available rooms we cannot guarantee the accomodation. The decision may even be made shortly before the beginning of the semester. Half of the residences are coordinated by the Studentenwerk. The prices range between approx. 150,- and 300,-? per month. For double rooms between approx. 128,- and 220,-? per month and person. There is only one application form for all residences of the Studentenwerk, which is sent with the letter of acceptance. You can request it at the IO as well. Private Residences Apart from the student residences of the Studentenwerk, Regensburg also counts with private student residences. You need to apply directly to these residences, since each one has an independent administration. You will receive an address list of the private student residences with your acceptance letter or you may access it here. Christine Betzner - 23.05.2014 09:48 UR International Accommodation Sigrid Baumann Information and advice on accommodation for international students Contact

Admission - Universität Regensburg Admission - Universität Regensburg UR Home International Degree Seeking Students News Degree Programmes German Skills Application / Admission / Registration How to Apply Application Deadlines Submitting Your Application Studienkolleg Undergraduate Studies Transfer Students Graduate Programmes Doctoral Students Admission Enrolment Visa and Residence Regulations Finances Health Services Arrival Information Accommodation Startklar ? Orientation Programme Organizing Your Studies Life in Regensburg FAQ Download Contact Admission Admission As soon as the University receives your application, it will review whether the academic and language prerequisites for admission have been fulfilled. In subjects with restrictions on the number of students admitted, a ranking list will be compiled on the basis of secondary school and higher education grades, and the top candidates on the list will be admitted. In subjects with an aptitude test, your application normally will be reviewed by a committee selected by the department to which you have applied. The criteria that form the basis for selecting the applicants will be stipulated in the examination requirements of the subject. If and when the application proceedings are successful, you will receive a notification of admission from the Office of the Registrar (Studentenkanzlei) in the mail. In a few instances, it may take up to two months after the application deadline until your application is reviewed and you receive the official answer of the University. The notification of admission states exactly the latest date when you must arrive at the University. Dates of compulsory language courses, aptitude exams, or placement exams also are listed as well as the time period of enrolment (matriculation), by which you will register officially at the University and receive your student identification. Orientation Programme Organizing Your Studies Life in Regensburg FAQ Download Contact Enrolment With your enrolment you become officially a student of Universität Regensburg. In your letter of admission we will state on which days you can enrol and which documents you need to bring. For your enrolment you need to bring some kind of proof of health insurance. This health insurance certificate needs to be handed in at a statutary health insurance. You will also need to show the originals of your school leaving certificates and (if you have already studies) your previous university education. After having paid the student service fee, you will receive your student ID and your "Studienbuch". With your student ID you can use the library, the computer terminals, sports centre and public transportation in Regensburg. On Campus Techniker Krankenkasse (a German statutary health insurance) has its own Service-Point for students: Josef-Engert-Str. 11, 93053 Regensburg Tel: 0941/40 96 206 What is "Rückmeldung"? The enrolment is only valid for one semester. After that you will need to re-register every semester and pay your student service fee as well as your tuition. The re-registration can be done online. Please make sure that you always update your latest address if you have moved. Who will help you with all the formalities? The tutors in the International Office will help you will all formalities. During the orientation programme "Startklar", they will explain everything step by step. Christine Betzner - 14.11.2012 13:47 UR International International Degree Seeking Students Elli Wunderlich Term dates Application deadlines Scholarships FAQ ? CONTACT

How to Apply - Universität Regensburg How to Apply - Universität Regensburg UR Home International Degree Seeking Students News Degree Programmes German Skills Application / Admission / Registration How to Apply Application Deadlines Submitting Your Application Studienkolleg Undergraduate Studies Transfer Students Graduate Programmes Doctoral Students Admission Enrolment Visa and Residence Regulations Finances Health Services Arrival Information Accommodation Startklar ? Orientation Programme Organizing Your Studies Life in Regensburg FAQ Download Contact How to Apply How to apply? The following information applies to international student applicants and so-called Bildungsausländer. If you have a foreign nationality but a German Abitur (either from a German school in Germany or from a German school abroad) you are treated as a Bildungsinländer. For further information on the subjects Bildungsinländer and Bildungsausländer please see below. Application deadlines For most degree programmes (all undergraduate programmes) the application within these deadlines: 1 May - 15 July for the winter semester 1 December - 15 January for the summer semester Please note that application that are handed in after 15 July or 15 January cannot be accepted. Most master programmes have earlier deadlines! The application must have been received by the deadline. The postmark date will not be taken into account! Important documents The following documents must be enclosed: application form, financial declaration, copy of passport, diplomas etc. (please also see our download section for all download forms). German Skills Please send in a certificate of your German skills. Without this document, no letter of acceptance will be issued! You will find more detailed information about the required language skills here! Visa Apply for the right form of visa, i.e. Student Visa (Studentenvisum) or Prospective Student Visa (Studienbewerbervisum) if you want to take the preparatory German-language course Do not enter under any circumstance as a tourist! Once you enter Germany, a tourist visa cannot be converted into a student visa. Definition of Bildungsinländer and Bildungsausländer. Bildungsinländer "Bildungsinländer" are international applicants with a German Abitur including applicants from a German school abroad. They have to apply like all German applicants. For further information please see the homepage of our registrar:Studentenkanzlei. Bildungsausländer "Bildungsausländer" are German applicants with a foreign school leaving certificate. They have to apply like all other international applicants. Please look here for an overview of how to apply. Christine Betzner - 30.06.2014 09:38 UR International International Degree Seeking Students Elli Wunderlich Term dates Application deadlines Scholarships FAQ ? CONTACT

Studienkolleg - Universität Regensburg Studienkolleg - Universität Regensburg UR Home International Degree Seeking Students News Degree Programmes German Skills Application / Admission / Registration How to Apply Application Deadlines Submitting Your Application Studienkolleg Undergraduate Studies Transfer Students Graduate Programmes Doctoral Students Admission Enrolment Visa and Residence Regulations Finances Health Services Arrival Information Accommodation Startklar ? Orientation Programme Organizing Your Studies Life in Regensburg FAQ Download Contact Studienkolleg What is the "Studienkolleg"? Some international applicants do not yet fulfill all academic requirements for the admission to a German university as their school leaving certificates or their academic qualification is not regarded as equivalent to the German Abitur. They have the possibilty to visit the "Studienkolleg". This college prepares them for their studies in Germany. The Studienkolleg in Munich is the college for all 11 bavarian universities. While you are at the Studienkolleg, you receive an official student status. How do you apply for the Studienkolleg? You have to apply at one of the Bavarian universities for a place in the Studienkolleg in Munich. Preferably you apply to the university where you want to study after the Studienkolleg. You can receive the application form either online or through the International Office. With your application you have to hand in the same documents as for a regular application to a German university. Further information about the Studienkolleg München Christine Betzner - 14.11.2012 10:51 UR International International Degree Seeking Students Elli Wunderlich Term dates Application deadlines Scholarships FAQ ? CONTACT

Orientation Programme Organizing Your Studies Life in Regensburg FAQ Download Contact Submitting Your Application Depending on nationality and subject, applicants must turn in their documents at Hochschulstart.de (former ZVS) or directly at University of Regensburg Applying at Hochschulstart.de Applicants from EU-member countries (starting from January 1, 2007 applicants from Bulgaria and Romania are members of this group), from Norway, from Liechtenstein, and from Iceland as well as Bildungsinländer (international applicants with a German Abitur) must apply to the Zentralen Vergabestelle für Studienplätze (ZVS) (a federal office responsible for allocating places in higher education) in Dortmund for the following degree programmes: Pharmacy Human medicine Dentistry Application Documents You can find the application documents and information about the application procedure in the Internet under http://www.hochschulstart.de Also see the information below on deadlines and where to apply to. Applying at University of Regensburg All other applicants should send their application directly to University of Regensburg. Studienkolleg Undergraduate Studies Transfer Students Graduate Programmes Doctoral Studies Where to apply Address Please send your application to the following address: Hochschulstart.de Postfach 44128 Dortmund http://www.hochschulstart.de Deadlines Application Deadlines For summer semester: January 15 For winter semester: May 31 for applicants who acquired their university entrance certificate before January 16 of the actual year July 15 for applicants who acquire their university entrance certificate after January 16 of the actual year Christine Betzner - 22.01.2014 12:05 UR International International Degree Seeking Students Elli Wunderlich Term dates Application deadlines Scholarships FAQ ? Orientation Programme Organizing Your Studies Life in Regensburg FAQ Download Contact Transfer Students Applying as a Tranfer Student If you already are studying abroad or have already completed a degree and would like to continue your studies at the University of Regensburg and with that have the exams you passed in your home country recognized by the University, please refer to the individual faculties. The application for recognition for studies abroad must be directed toward the examination board of that faculty so that the studies from abroad are documented exactly. For these state examinations (law, pharmacy, medicine, and dentistry), you must apply to the examination office responsible for recognizing credits earned from the study abroad. You can get a list of addresses of the examination offices from the International Office. Undergraduate Studies - Universität Regensburg Undergraduate Studies - Universität Regensburg UR Home International Degree Seeking Students News Degree Programmes German Skills Application / Admission / Registration How to Apply Application Deadlines Submitting Your Application Studienkolleg Undergraduate Studies Transfer Students Graduate Programmes Doctoral Students Admission Enrolment Visa and Residence Regulations Finances Health Services Arrival Information Accommodation Startklar ? Orientation Programme Organizing Your Studies Life in Regensburg FAQ Download Contact Undergraduate Studies Application at the University for a First Degree All international students who do not have to apply to the ZVS should apply directly to the University of Regensburg. Application forms Requests for the forms for the applications may be made at the International Office or at the Office of the Registrar (Studentenkanzlei). The application form for admission can also be opened, filled out, and printed as a PDF document in the Internet (download): Which documents must you enclose? Secondary school diplomas Proof of your academic studies, in case you have already studied abroad or in Germany (for example diplomas, transcripts, summary of grades, etc.) Proof of your German proficiency (for example certificates from German-language courses or of participation in courses): to apply for studies you must demonstrate at least 800 hours of German instruction (see Language Requirements) Financial Declaration: Included with the application documents is a statement that you possess the adequate finances for your living and those necessary for your academic-study during the projected duration of your academic study. You can download this financial declaration here. Copy of passport How should the documents be formatted and enclosed? Notarised copy of the original: the notarisation must be made from a German site, best of all from the German Embassy in your home country. Notarised translation (notarised through a sworn translator) of the documents in a foreign language Exception: Certificates in English and French do not need to be translated Application for a German language course If you want to apply for a preparatory German-language course, the application is carried out just like the regular application for academic study. Application forms, certificates, and proof of your German-language proficiency (proof of level A2 when applying). Please check YES on item 11 last page of the application form ("Antrag auf Zulassung zum Sprachkurs"). Because only a limited number of places are available, not all applicants are able to be admitted. Students who do not receive a place should enrol in an intensive language course at a private language school in the city. Application deadlines The following application deadlines apply to almost all first degree programmes: January 15, for the Summer semester July 15, for the Winter semester Exceptions: A few first degree programmes with selection processes have earlier application deadlines. You will find these deadlines on the lists of subjects offered. Address Please send your documents to the following address: Universität Regensburg Studentenkanzlei Universitätsstr. 31 93053 Regensburg Christine Betzner - 05.06.2014 11:39 UR International International Degree Seeking Students Elli Wunderlich Term dates Application deadlines Scholarships FAQ ? CONTACT

Orientation Programme Organizing Your Studies Schedule Course Results Information and Advice Term Dates Life in Regensburg FAQ Download Contact Course Results Course Results Currently, the central computer system at UR only records your courses and grades in some but not all programmes of study. This computer system is called FlexNow. Once the results of the examinations have been determined, they will be entered into FlexNow by your instructor and you can see the results online. In the programmes that have not yet introduced FlexNow, students receive a certificate for the courses they take from the lecturer or professor. This certificate is called a ?Schein?. It states the course title, the number of hours and the grade. You have to pick up the ?Schein? certificates from your professors and then place them in your ?Studienbuch?. When you register for examinations, the examination office will check to make certain you have all the required ?Schein? certificates.
